title: How to Halve an Egg

steps.headline: Crack the egg into a bowl.
steps.description: Gently tap the egg against the edge of the bowl or on the counter. Once you get a crack in the shell, place your finger in the crack and pull the shell apart. Then dump the whole egg – the white and the yolk – into the bowl.

steps.headline: Whisk the yolk and white together.
steps.description: You can use a fork or whisk for this. Move the fork or whisk in a circular motion in the egg, making sure to break the yoke. The egg is fully whisked when the mixture is a yellow color.

steps.headline: Split the mixture in half.
steps.description: You can measure the whisked egg in a measuring cup or with a scale if you have one. Split it in half by removing half of the total amount (usually with a small cup or spoon).

methods.name: Halving an Egg White or Yolk

steps.headline: Separate the white and yolk using the shell.
steps.description: Crack the egg gently, pull the shell apart, and then use the shell itself to separate the egg. Hold the shell halves a few inches apart over a bowl. Pour the yolk back and forth between the two halves until the white falls away.

steps.headline: Separate the egg using a sieve.
steps.description: Simply crack the shell, dump the white and yolk into the sieve, and watch the white fall away.

steps.headline: Whisk the white or yolk.
steps.description: Once you’ve separated the egg, whisk the part you need in a small bowl. The white is properly whisked when it becomes a little bit frothy. The yolk is properly whisked when it’s a bit bubbly.

steps.headline: Split the mixture in half.
steps.description: Once you’re done whisking the yolk or white, use a measuring cup to remove half of the mixture. Freeze the rest.
